messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

clang-format: /tmp/llvm-gh-136814/build/clang/lib/Format/UnwrappedLineParser.cpp:1189: void clang::format::UnwrappedLineParser::parsePPDefine(): Assertion `(int)Line->PPLevel >= 0' failed.
Stack dump:
0.	Program arguments: ./build/bin/clang-format /testcases/llvm-gh-136814/input/poc.cpp "--style={IndentPPDirectives: BeforeHash}"
    - llvm::sys::PrintStackTrace(llvm::raw_ostream&, int) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:804:22
    - PrintStackTraceSignalHandler(void*) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:880:1
    - llvm::sys::RunSignalHandlers() llvm/lib/Support/Signals.cpp:105:20
    - SignalHandler(int, siginfo_t*, void*) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:418:13
    - clang::format::UnwrappedLineParser::parsePPDefine() clang/lib/Format/UnwrappedLineParser.cpp:1190:7
    - clang::format::UnwrappedLineParser::parsePPDirective() clang/lib/Format/UnwrappedLineParser.cpp:1010:5
    - clang::format::UnwrappedLineParser::readToken(int) clang/lib/Format/UnwrappedLineParser.cpp:4886:28
    - clang::format::UnwrappedLineParser::parse() clang/lib/Format/UnwrappedLineParser.cpp:212:14
    - clang::format::TokenAnalyzer::process(bool) clang/lib/Format/TokenAnalyzer.cpp:114:3
    - clang::format::internal::reformat(clang::format::FormatStyle const&, llvm::StringRef, llvm::ArrayRef<clang::tooling::Range>, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, llvm::StringRef, clang::format::FormattingAttemptStatus*)::'lambda5'(clang::format::Environment const&)::operator()(clang::format::Environment const&) const clang/lib/Format/Format.cpp:3866:16
    - clang::format::internal::reformat(clang::format::FormatStyle const&, llvm::StringRef, llvm::ArrayRef<clang::tooling::Range>, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, llvm::StringRef, clang::format::FormattingAttemptStatus*) clang/lib/Format/Format.cpp:3914:9
    - clang::format::reformat(clang::format::FormatStyle const&, llvm::StringRef, llvm::ArrayRef<clang::tooling::Range>, llvm::StringRef, clang::format::FormattingAttemptStatus*) clang/lib/Format/Format.cpp:3956:28
    - clang::format::format(llvm::StringRef, bool) clang/tools/clang-format/ClangFormat.cpp:510:76
    - main clang/tools/clang-format/ClangFormat.cpp:738:11

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

26| /// An unwrapped line is a sequence of \c Token, that we would like to
27| /// put on a single line if there was no column limit.
28| ///
29| /// This is used as a main interface between the \c UnwrappedLineParser and the
30| /// \c UnwrappedLineFormatter. The key property is that changing the formatting
31| /// within an unwrapped line does not affect any other unwrapped lines.
32| struct UnwrappedLine {
33|   UnwrappedLine() = default;
34| 
35|   /// The \c Tokens comprising this \c UnwrappedLine.
36|   std::list<UnwrappedLineNode> Tokens;

39|   unsigned Level = 0;

messages.message:
Invoking: `validate` with `{'patch': '--- a/clang/lib/Format/UnwrappedLineParser.cpp\n+++ b/clang/lib/Format/UnwrappedLineParser.cpp\n@@ -1187,7 +1187,9 @@\n \n-  Line->PPLevel = PPBranchLevel + (IncludeGuard == IG_Defined ? 0 : 1);\n-  assert((int)Line->PPLevel >= 0);\n+  Line->PPLevel = std::max(0, PPBranchLevel + (IncludeGuard == IG_Defined ? 0 : 1));\n+  assert((int)Line->PPLevel >= 0);\n'}`
responded: The assertion failure in the sanitizer report is:
```
clang-format: /tmp/llvm-gh-136814/build/clang/lib/Format/UnwrappedLineParser.cpp:1189: void clang::format::UnwrappedLineParser::parsePPDefine(): Assertion `(int)Line->PPLevel >= 0' failed.
```
This means that `Line->PPLevel` is being set to a negative value at line 1188:
```cpp
Line->PPLevel = PPBranchLevel + (IncludeGuard == IG_Defined ? 0 : 1);
assert((int)Line->PPLevel >= 0);
```
Given that `PPBranchLevel` can be negative (as seen in other code, e.g., `PPBranchLevel == -1`), this assignment can result in a negative value for `Line->PPLevel`, which triggers the assertion.

**Patch Plan:**
- Before assigning to `Line->PPLevel`, ensure the value is not negative. The logic should clamp the value to zero if it would otherwise be negative.
- This can be done by using `std::max(0, PPBranchLevel + (IncludeGuard == IG_Defined ? 0 : 1))`.

Let's generate the patch.

message.name: validate
message.result: patch found
